definition: horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: The soldiers are standing in a row.
sentences.chinese: 战士们正列队站成一横排。
横排孔中心离地面距离。

sentences.english: Now the makeup of books by printing houses has long been changed from vertical linage to horizontal linage .
sentences.chinese: 现在出版社排版书的方式早已从原来的竖排改成横排。

sentences.english: The emotion beyond poetry could be organized gracefully certain.
sentences.chinese: 诗以外的文字情绪，当然可是横排混血的很美丽。

sentences.english: The emotion beyond poetry could be organized gracefully for certain.
sentences.chinese: 诗以外的文字情绪当然可以横排混血的很美丽。

definition: form of a Chinese character/variant of 字型[zi4 xing2]
traditional form of Chinese, as opposed to simplified form 簡體|简体[jian3 ti3]
simplified form of Chinese characters, as opposed to traditional form 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3]
to fold the corner of a page/to dog-ear
